name: BBN Empathy Annotation Schema
description: Annotation schema for Breaking Bad News conversations based on Appraisal Framework for Clinical Empathy

empathic_opportunities.description: Expressions or behaviors that reveal a patient's feelings or views

explicit.label: explicit_feeling
explicit.description: Direct expression of emotion, emotive behavior, or mental state
examples: I'm sad
I cried
I'm in pain
I feel alone

implicit.label: implicit_feeling
implicit.description: Indirect expression of feeling through references to experiences
examples: My aunt had the same condition and didn't make it
Everything was going well until...

explicit.label: explicit_appreciation
explicit.description: Direct attitude toward things, events, actions, or behaviors
examples: The MRI was boring
The medication is not helping me

implicit.label: implicit_appreciation
implicit.description: Indirect attitude toward things, events, actions, or behaviors
examples: My symptoms don't seem to improve with the medication

explicit.label: explicit_judgement
explicit.description: Direct attitude toward self or others
examples: I'm not good at medication adherence
The nurses weren't helpful

implicit.label: implicit_judgement
implicit.description: Indirect attitude toward self or others
examples: I'm not very consistent about taking my medication

elicitations.description: Clinician attempts to elicit patient's feelings and perspectives

direct.label: direct_elicitation_feeling
direct.description: Direct inquiry about patient's emotions or mental state
examples: How do you feel about that?
What was your reaction?

indirect.label: indirect_elicitation_feeling
indirect.description: Indirect inquiry about experiences or emotive behaviors
examples: So you're worried that the treatment won't work

direct.label: direct_elicitation_appreciation
direct.description: Direct inquiry about patient's appreciation of things/events
examples: How was the MRI for you?
Do you find the medication helpful?

indirect.label: indirect_elicitation_appreciation
examples: It sounds like the medication isn't helping

direct.label: direct_elicitation_judgement
direct.description: Direct inquiry about patient's judgement of self or others
examples: Do you think you are a good father?
Was the nurse helpful?

indirect.label: indirect_elicitation_judgement
indirect.description: Indirect inquiry about behaviors or interpretations
examples: So the nurse was not very helpful then?

responses.description: Clinician's empathic responses to patient cues

explicit_positive_judgement.label: acceptance_positive_regard_explicit_judgement
explicit_positive_judgement.description: Expression of positive judgment of the patient as a person
examples: You are a reasonable parent
You're very responsible

implicit_positive_judgement.label: acceptance_positive_regard_implicit_judgement
implicit_positive_judgement.description: Expression of judgement of patient's thoughts or feelings
examples: It's really great that you've been taking care of your parents

repetition.label: acceptance_positive_regard_repetition
repetition.description: Repeating or paraphrasing patient's words without countering
examples: I understand you're worried about the cancer spreading

allowing_full_expression.label: acceptance_positive_regard_allowing
allowing_full_expression.description: Allowing patients to express feelings fully
examples: Minimal responses, nodding, avoidance of interruption

explicit_appreciation.label: acceptance_neutral_support_appreciation
explicit_appreciation.description: Appreciation of ideas, feelings, or behaviors regarding normality
examples: It's completely normal to be upset about this

explicit_judgement.label: acceptance_neutral_support_judgement
explicit_judgement.description: Denying negative self-assessment by the patient
examples: You're not crazy for being worried about that

feeling.label: sharing_feeling
feeling.description: Sharing patient feelings through expressed agreement
examples: I'm sure I would also feel anxious in this situation

appreciation.label: sharing_appreciation
appreciation.description: Sharing patient views through expressed agreement
examples: Yes, this medication really does not taste good

judgement.label: sharing_judgement
judgement.description: Sharing patient judgements through expressed agreement
examples: Oh, no!

feeling.label: understanding_feeling
feeling.description: Understanding and acknowledgement of patient's feelings
examples: I understand that you're worried about infections

appreciation.label: understanding_appreciation
appreciation.description: Understanding and acknowledgement of patient's views
examples: I see that the medication isn't working for you

judgement.label: understanding_judgement
judgement.description: Understanding and acknowledgement of patient's judgements
examples: I get the sense that you found the other doctor unhelpful

spikes_stages.description: SPIKES Protocol stages for Breaking Bad News conversations

invitation.label: invitation
invitation.description: Assessing how much information patient wants
